hy: Please tell us the problem, and we'll try to help you.
in the xterm window, type "sudo apt-get install java-common"
It may ask you if you want to continue. Hit "y".
Are you in an xterm window?
OK. If you want to try again, please hit alt-f2 and type "xterm" without the e at the begining.
It should ask you for your password. Make sure that you type that in.
OK. Which webbrowser are you using?
Ok. Try starting mozilla, and try visiting a page that has java on it.
You should already have java installed. That's what we just did.
